summary.Title: Incubator Manager
summary.Presentation: Do you get energy from motivating others and thrive with high level of responsibility, self-determination and great co-workers? Do you have flair for business development and technological innovation,

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Do you get energy from motivating others and thrive with high level of responsibility, self-determination and great co-workers? Do you have flair for business development and technological innovation, and wish to unfold your skills with the next generation of startups from DTU? Then continue reading.

DTU Skylab is looking for an ambitious Incubator Manager to head our vibrant workspace for committed technology startups. You will coach student and researcher startups in building their businesses. Your primary tasks will be to:
  • Manage the incubator. Take charge of organizing the program, activities, community, physical space as well as the application, selection and onboarding processes. You will be the central person in the daily operation of the incubator.
  • Coach the startups on various business topics such as team development, funding, pitching etc.
  • Manage projects related to our startup activities

You will get hands-on experience with startups developing everything from medical devices to advanced software solutions. The Incubator teams are already - or close to becoming - full-time committed to their startups. As Incubator Manager, you will also coach startups part of DTU Skylab's other startup programmes who are at all stages from recent idea to seed level.

You will therefore work closely with our other startup coaches, and become involved in DTU's startup accelerator and funding programme.

You will be a part of the Startup & Partnerships section consisting of 12 project managers and project coordinators. It is a challenging job in a very dynamic environment with both business suits and welding masks. Your work will depend on all sections in DTU Skylab and you will become a part of a culture and organization in constant rapid development, and you will have a lot of influence on this development.

We expect that you have:
  • A great passion for what you do and a sense of natural leadership that enables you to bring people together, and create an open and curious atmosphere
  • Minimum a few years of firsthand working experience in a startup, preferably from a technology startup
  • High level of self-drive, energy and can-do attitude
  • Excellent communications skills both on stage and in writing
  • Project management skills
  • Particular interest within team formation and dynamics would be an extra plus

Who are we?
DTU Skylab is the innovation & entrepreneurship hub of DTU. We are a vibrant community with startups and company collaborations, and an ambitious learning environment where we train skilled engineers with a desire to make a difference in the world. In the 8 years that DTU Skylab has existed, it has grown from a pilot project in a basement to become a dynamic innovation hub with 5000 m2 of offices, teaching facilities, workshops and laboratories.

We are approx. 50 full time employees in 4 sections. We have an informal culture and we can laugh, party, while being very serious about what we do. We love our users and the variety of great projects running in DTU Skylab, such as; building rockets, farming snails, developing laboratory robots, digital services, student associations, international summits and airborne wind turbines.

Terms of employment
The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations (AC) or other relevant agreements. The period of employment is 3 years. The position is to be filled by 1 August 2022. You will refer to the Head of the Startups & Partnerships Section.

You will be employed at DTU Skylab and the workplace is DTU Lyngby Campus, Kgs. Lyngby, Denmark.

Application and contact
Please submit your online application no later than 15 May 2022 (Danish time). Open the 'Apply online' link, fill out the form and attach your motivated application, CV and exam certificates.

If you wish to learn more about DTU Skylab and the position then feel free to contact Section Head Jakob Svagin, jsva@dtu.dk / 2872 0488, or Programme Manager Diana Lundgren, dialu@dtu.dk / 5315 1808.

Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.

All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.

Technology for people
DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN's 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear vision to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That vision lives on today. DTU has 12,900 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.
